Hello everyone,

Since 2009 the meta header tag rel=3Dcanonical are support=
ed by the big search engines. 

For better understanding see: RFC 6596 - ht=
tp://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6596

...
 The canonical link relation specifie=
s the preferred IRI from
   resources with duplicative content.  Common imp=
lementations of the
   canonical link relation are to specify the preferred=
 version of an
   IRI from duplicate pages created with the addition of IRI=
 parameters
   (e.g., session IDs) or to specify the single-page version as=

   preferred over the same content separated on multiple component
   page=
s.
....

Google understand the canonical tag from the technical view as a 3=
01 redirect. 

Is there a possibility or workaround to add canonical URLs i=
n the crawl-list ?

for example: 

Site a.html:

<link rel=3D"canonical" hr=
ef=3D"b.html">

"b.html" has no internal Links. 
So i want to add b.html in=
to the crawl queue. 

This is a very important functions for us. Maybe some=
one have some hints how we can implement this logic. I think there is no ch=
ance to define it into the XML Beans. 

best regards 
Tom
